meanings.definition: A period of time approximately equal to the period of the moon's revolution and amounting to about 30 days or 4 weeks.
meanings.sent1: In a few months, we will celebrate my birthday.
meanings.sent2: She marked the passing months on her calendar.
meanings.sent3: The months seemed to be playing hide and seek with us.
meanings.sent4: Time slipped through his fingers like sand in the months.
meanings.sent5: The months marched on, relentless in their progression.
meanings.sent6: After a few months, the flowers in the garden bloomed beautifully.
meanings.sent7: The months passed by quickly as they enjoyed their summer vacation.
meanings.sent8: The months whispered secrets of change in the wind.
meanings.sent9: The months were like puzzle pieces fitting together to form a year.
meanings.sent10: The months painted the landscape with the colors of autumn.

meanings.definition: One of the twelve parts into which the year is divided, each having a name and number.
meanings.sent1: December is one of the coldest months of the year.
meanings.sent2: She planned her vacation for the summer months.
meanings.sent3: The months of the year danced around the calendar.
meanings.sent4: In the months of spring, nature comes alive with new beginnings.
meanings.sent5: The months of the year are like chapters in a book, each with its own story.
meanings.sent6: The winter months bring snow and cold temperatures.
meanings.sent7: The months of the year passed by in a blur of activities.
meanings.sent8: The months of the year are like a colorful mosaic on the calendar.
meanings.sent9: The summer months are filled with warmth and sunshine.
meanings.sent10: The months of the year are like a journey through the seasons.
